titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the A. E. Weldon collection of papers, 1923-1958

did.unittitle: A. E. Weldon collection of papers

repository.corpname: The New York Public Library. Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature.

address.addressline: Fifth Avenue at 42nd Street, New York, NY 10018-2788

did.abstract: This is a synthetic collection consisting of manuscripts, a typescript, correspondence, and legal documents.

bioghist.p: A. E. (or John) Weldon was an Irish novelist, playwright, poet, essayist, and theater critic. He wrote under the pseudonym Brinsley MacNamara.

scopecontent.p: This is a synthetic collection consisting of manuscripts, a typescript, correspondence, and legal documents. The manuscript is a play by the author, entitled "Margaret Gillian"; the typescript is a review of MacNamara's work by William Butler Yeats. The correspondence includes letters, dating from 1927 to 1958, from the author to Ria Mooney.

prefercite.p: [Identification of the item]. The Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature, The New York Public Library.

acqinfo.p: This is a synthetic collection, created from materials acquired through gift and purchase from various sources.

processinfo.p: Processed by Staff; Machine-readable finding aid created by Lynn Lobash and Nina Schneider.

userestrict.p: For permission to publish, contact the Curator, The Henry W. and Albert A. Berg Collection of English and American Literature.

did.unittitle: Manuscripts and Typescripts written by MacNamara
Margaret Gillan. Holograph play. Paginated 46 p.; 45 p.; 42 p.

scopecontent.p: Signed. With: Abbey theatre programme for the week of July 17, 1933, laid in. Published, London: G. Allen & Unwin ltd., 1934. Inscribed by the author for Deirdre O'Donovan, April 28, 1943

did.unittitle: Manuscripts and Typescripts relating to MacNamara
Yeats, William Butler. Reader's opinion on Mr. MacNamara's play. Typescript with the author's ms. corrections

scopecontent.p: Signed Brinsley MacNamara. With carbon of Ria Mooney's letter to MacNamara of Nov. 14, 1958. 1 p.

did.unittitle: Agreements (19) between Brinsley MacNamara, pseud. of A. E. Weldon, and The National theatre society, ltd., Dublin, for the performance of various plays by Macnamara

scopecontent.p: Signed by Frederick Robert Higgins, J. H. Perrin, Lennox Robinson and others
